result.execSummary:
All charges against Lamar L Cammon in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lamar L Cammon is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:55 PM Defendant Lamar L Cammon in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Lamar L Cammon.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.

Case is dismissed outright per plea on 21CM2168.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 15, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

1:52 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Lamar L Cammon appeared by Zoom, in custody at the Milwaukee County Jail.  Attorney Steven Hughes appeared by Zoom for Lamar L Cammon. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 

The Court goes over the procedural history of the case.
The State gives its bail recommendation.
The Defense gives its bail recommendation.
The Court quashes the warrant.
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT BE PRODUCE FROM THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL FOR THE NEXT COURT DATE.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on August 25, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Motion to forfeit bail granted.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

01:15 PM Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lamar L Cammon in court by zoom video, in custody at Milwaukee County Jail.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant states he has not yet heard from the Public Defenders office but the Court notes they were just notified of this case on 03-17-22.  Clerk's office to set up video appearance from the Milwaukee County Jail for the next date.  Court notifies defendant if he is released from Milwaukee prior to the next date, he must appear in person.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Initial appearance on March 24, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
